A one day programming competition in central Switzerland.

Build a snake bot and defeat your opponents

11 Nov 2017 — Rotkreuz, Switzerland

Event on Facebook

SnakeHack is a one-day programming competition in Rotkreuz in the Innovationspark Zentralschweiz on the HSLU campus.
Teams of students build web-based Bots for the game “Snake” and let them compete against each other.
Whether you’re a seasoned hackathon veteran or have never been to a programming competition before, SnakeHack will be an unforgettable event for you.

FAQ

What is a programming competition?

Teams of students try to solve a specific task with code in a short period of time.

How much does it cost?

Nothing. Attending this competition is free.

Where is the event?

The event is being hosted at Innovationspark Zentralschweiz, Suurstoffi 41 in Rotkreuz.

Will there be food?

Yes, there is free food. We will provide food, snacks and drinks for everyone through the day.

What is Major League Hacking?

Major League Hacking is the official student hackathon league in North America & Europe. We work with over 200 Member Events and empower over 70,000 students every year.

Is there a code of conduct?

Yes there is. You can find it here.
